critique: This document pertains to the Emergency Relief Appropriation Act of 1935 and authorizes the Director of Procurement of the Treasury Department to certify and approve vouchers and schedules of disbursements chargeable to any appropriation-allocation under the Act. It outlines specific conditions for such vouchers, including payment for materials, supplies, and equipment purchased by the Secretary of the Treasury or for reimbursing the Work Relief Supply Fund. The document ensures that materials purchased have been duly received by the requisitioning department. Given the context of the Great Depression and the New Deal, this document reflects a government interventionist approach to economic recovery.
